doc.field: American Institute of the City of New York for the Encouragement of Science and Invention records
American Institute of the City of New York for the Encouragement of Science and Invention records

The scrapbooks generally fall into two categories: scrapbooks containing newspaper clippings and scrapbooks containing various printed items (usually circulars, pamphlets, tickets, forms, and announcements). Most material refers to American Institute events and programs. In addition, a few volumes contain correspondence, mostly letters to members. A number of clippings scrapbooks deal specifically with the Institute's Farmers Club.
American Institute of the City of New York for the Encouragement of Science and Invention records
